63Bg-dvgBw2WIEePbJ8lOw.text: I went here tonight and its so much fun. I always thought it looked a bit weird from the outside but it was brilliant. We  went here for a drink when Vibe and the other brick lane places were full and got a cool orange leather booth to ourselves. The music was brilliant, I loved every song; a mixture of Kings of Leon, Rolling stones and the killers. The drinks aren't that expensive either. I had a miller light on draught which was less than £3 and my friend had a mojito for £7.50. The bar staff are really nice and actually really smiley, none of that sulky serious stuff.Next time I go I'm going to reserve a bowling lane because it looked like so much fun. I'm going to be back very soon.

echmusHWrTgqwm9OGUMQRg.text: When you walk in you know its the real deal, maybe even more so then in the states because in the heart of shorditch they know how to do retro!And not the kind of retro that stinks of self importance, they are all lovely polite and very friendly. a highly recomended night out/date/birthday event. you cant go wrong with a bit of bowling in my book!

LqSTgBiLidFaPa1mWPzWig.text: Good place to hang out and play some pool. Good beer options, and decent food on offer.

-yt2gRupfI_NQaHlYXBjBQ.text: All Star Lanes in Brick Lane is a great place for a group of you to chill out, eat and have a good drink. The crows is youthful and loud, typical of a bowling alley.On Friday and Saturday night, a DJ will be playing a set whilst people bowl, eat junk food, drink and party, it is a great vibe. Its an American diner/ sports lounge, colourful and loud.What is great, is that its surrounded by other cool places in Brick Lane, and there is so much more to do in the area when the place closes, the latest it will ever close is 12.30.The last time I went to the All Stars, I had cocktails for the whole night, which are around £7-8. There were a few of us that night, and if in the scenario one of us didn't want to bowl, there would have been no problems as so much is going on in here. It's a good night out at the All Stars, and not too damaging on the pocket.

7I3I2LEyEs2DG6iqV3gLaQ.text: Great 50's themed bowling alley bar and diner. Friendly helpful staff. Good food and not too bad on price. A good place for going out in a group.

ssX-Hsjm_lgZ3hFR1qmZOA.text: A lively diner with a fun 50s vibe going on, at very much 2010 prices. They stock Blue Moon, my favourite American beer, and offer the usual array of burgers and sides. Seems to cater for big groups well, with some seriously long booths. My complaint is with the usual British-restaurant meanness: when I pay £9 for a burger and you charge me an extra 50p for bacon, please don't come back with one measly, shrivelled rasher. It makes you look tight, which you clearly are. Luckily, anyone feeling ripped off can bowl away the pain.

0zkXKJ3HpQe4gYxqFdRyOg.text: All star Lanes  Brick Lane. Absolutely loved the night out with friends. American themed retro fittings, very warm and buzzing place. Food and drink available at reasonable prices. We had a fantastic Indian meal down the road before finishing the night off with drinks and ten pin bowling. An amazing set up. The staff were very friendly.Great music being played in the background. What more can I say go try it out. They have 3 branches, we chose brick lane because of the brilliant choice of Indian Restaurants there.

okNM2qa7-lmt_0ug7F4r1w.text: Good fun. Surprised by the nice service and quality of the food. I'm usually am very hard to please. I wasn't expecting it to be as pleasant being a Saturday night, the bar was nicely busy and the staff were polite in acknowledging you. Even the punters were an amiable bunch and not poseurs. Almost seemed like it wasn't London! Table service on the lanes was non-existent mind you. We were a large group and were seated after bowling for dinner. The staff were polite and seamless, the menu had just the right amount of choice. I wouldn't usually order a salad but I did anyway and was surprised that it was reasonably priced, fresh, tasty, main ingredients were not frugal and generous portioning. Hats off to the chef for keeping his/her charges up to scratch! The food came quickly and no orders were messed up. My fellow dinners were also satisfied with their meatier choices. I would come here again, I just hope that it wasn't a one off! One thing missing on the menu that would have made the experience complete, the all-American root beer!

4oa9MdGD6CZlDzorjdfh4A.text: I went here for my christmas party. There was a good choice of food on the menu I had a steak that to be fair could have been better quality. For the prices you are paying you would expect it the food to be slightly better.. but I do have high standards! The bowling was brilliant! you can even get your own customised bowling shirts! and there is waitress service on the lanes so you dont have to leave your game to get a bevvie All in all an excelllent night out!

WPC9pAo20QdwD7VK4QJkJQ.text: All Stare Lanes was cool.  And no, no I'm not saying that simply because I'm American.  The staff was really friendly, and the food was good.  The alcohol milkshakes (rum!) alone deserve 5 stars, those babies are loaded (I think I may have recieved extra-shots).  The wings I ordered were delicious and above the regular "Hooters" wings one would commonly find in the states.  I also happened to stumble in on a free beer day, so I was pretty loaded by the time I left.  My friend & I went to All Star Lanes on the fourth of July, and although we weren't able to reserve a lane, the staff still let us in and we were able to hang out and party.  The ONLY issue I had with this place was with the inept security guard at the front door.  Upon entering, my friend and I BOTH got GROPED by some disgusting asshole, and the security guard did very little to protect two young women-in fact he didn't do anything.  Do your job & earn your wage, man.  ANWAY, this place is definitely one of my favorite spots on Brick Lane!

WTzhVHJLLYelW4v30GbCFQ.text: Great cocktails, stylish bowling and brilliant American dinner food.

WGKWhwfsa9SUzDsg0NCbsw.text: Dropped by last Sunday to warm up over a cup of coffee and rest our feet. Little did we know that our tired little feet were going to stay tired. Totally took us by surprise when DJs from Rough Trade jumped up and made magic happen using only two turntables and a microphone. We danced around like maniacs and took full advantage of the free bowling. Not a bad way to spend a Sunday evening!

fplZApQBHZzkn4JJl6WBSQ.text: Wow, such a cool place! I didn't even know it existed before last week - went with a group of friends to the Brick Lane Music Festival and decided to check out this place. We couldn't have picked a better day to swing on by - free bowling for anyone with a festival wristband. Pinch me, I'm dreaming. How sweet is that?! We were able to bowl 2 games and all the money we saved on bowling we happily spent on potent cocktails and good food from the bar menu. What's not to love about this place?!

Szwd8XZrMWD60pJV6Yim5Q.text: We held a corporate event in the private area for about 35 people.  It was a great scene - just the right tone of posh and relaxed.  Had a seamless experience with the host, Silvia, and the nice bartender, Dennis.  The food was also delicious and everything just flowed really well!!! I would definitely recommend this to anyone looking to hold a fun/interactive event aside from the usual dinner..

nZzckKQAx8Kr5EW8hUECXA.text: Okay... I waver on my review here, and I need to explain why.+ Amazing American bowling experience!- Nobody in London knows how to follow polite bowling etiquette (read: the fellow customers can be annoying)!+ Oreo milkshake! Butterfinger candy bar!- High prices for food!+ Able to bowl two games because the folks after us didn't show!- Only booked one game because nobody told us we were booking per game!+ Great location, in the heart of Shoreditch!- Have to make a reservation two weeks in advance because it's so popular!Okay, so you can see--it's splitsies. It's a fun experience, but really quite expensive. Kind of a token thing to do, but maybe not the only place you can have the experience, and certainly won't have to pay so much. I'm glad other reviewers have had a good time here--I'm probably being a bit harsh, because I did enjoy myself, but all of these things are worth noting. I'd love to come back for karaoke and to enjoy the bar and diner areas.

jzZ7kbiZGwm7yYGezwEk7A.text: This place was the perfect venue for my party--the staff were on the ball on this packed saturday night and took great care of us, the shoes were all in great shape, and I got a free cocktail for my birthday!It's good to be aware that the music is LOUD (though not too loud to talk over) and that the cocktails were universally really sickeningly sweet, but other than that I can't complain.Comfy seating for between games, flexible about bookings. I would definitely do this again. Probably for my next birthday :o)

bRNRGbQYOjeWfy_APxwf2Q.text: This is the best bowling experience I've had in London so far. It is pricier than Bloomsbury Bowling Lanes, but definitely worth it. I came here on a birthday party, which it's ideally suited to. Immediately as you enter there's a restaurant-type space that we skipped past to the bowling lanes. There aren't many bowling lanes there (four to six I think) and they're slightly shorter than standard-issue ones, but that's made up for by the excellent atmosphere: dimmed lighting and above all, when I was there, a superb funky soundtrack laid down by a DJ in the corner behind the bowlers. Off to the left there's a American-themed bar selling beers, soda floats, milkshakes and similar.After bowling our party headed for the karaoke rooms. The song list isn't as impressive as Lucky Voice's, and it has the quirk of listing different versions of the same song (e.g.Jeff Buckley's and Alexander Burke's versions of 'Hallelujah'. Did Burke add a new verse or two of 'Ooooooh's?), but it does the job. The ceilings in the rooms are high too, allowing taller clients to round off their musical expressions by standing on the seats, if they so desire.. One of the stand-out features of my experience there however was the drinks service, which was friendly, prompt and generous: our server allowed us plenty of extra time in our room after a delay, including not intervening when we changed our last song mid-way through after realising we'd made a mistake. Heck, he even sang along with us!Overall? I can't wait to have a party of my own here.

qlpomBYHqL-vcCpghiHXRg.text: Although it lives in the shadows of it's big sister, Grease 2 did give us the classic tune- 'Let's Bowl!'. Not familiar with it? Let me be your Michelle Pfeiffier circa 1978-Let's bowl, let's bowl, let's rock-'n-roll.Hey, come on, let's get this show on the road.Let's bowl, let's bowl, let's rock-'n-roll.We're sittin' on a bomb that's about to explode.Sadly lyrics alone fail to describe the true catchiness of this tune. Once it's in your head it's there all day. A-L-L D-A-Y. And so it was that a brief off hand joke about knocking over the recyling bottles with a galia melon that I was inspired, no compelled, to make a trip down to the newest All Star Lanes Brick Lane style.Being a big fan of American kitch, I was quite excited about visiting this bowling alley come diner come cocktail bar and asthetically at least it didn't disappoint. From the waitress' outfit to the old school tunes, this was 1950s Americana at it's best. I challenge anyone not to raise a smile when Go Johnny Go Go comes on the jukebox!Food-wise, All Star Lanes is pretty decent too. As well as a classic burger and steak selection, a little thought has clearly been put in to including a few posh salads and tasty pasta's. The booze menu is also fairly impressive ('Elderflower and Gin- who knew you would be such a delicious party in my mouth?') and so it was at this point that my expectations for the bowling itself were growing through the roof.Sadly it was here that I was disappointed. Having waited two hours for a lane (we foolishly hadn't booked) we were anticipating a marathon bowling session to truely establish the all time champion bowler. Twenty minutes, £13 and one game later we realised it wasn't to be. Yup, you gotta pay for these trendy surroundings! £6.50 per game, per person and a standard booking of only one game per couple- we found the whole thing a little anti-climatic. Especially after I rolled a gutter ball four times in a row...And so it is with that warning that I give a dubious Yelp recommendation. Do please go, enjoy the food and drinks, the music and quirky uniforms BUT book ahead, take your wallet and make sure you're not rushed into a one-game-blink-and-you'll-miss-it bowling blimp!

photos.caption: Photo of All Star Lanes - London, United Kingdom

Iyx3RhX0Fw6h8mG4Q-nM1w.text: My friend had his birthday party here and by the end of the night everyone in the group was trying to plan their bowling birthday too.  I love this place!The whole decor is great from the round amber lights, to the fancy purple A emblem at the end of the lanes.  The upstairs has 3 or 4 lanes, a private bar with black lights and white leather sofas.We didn't eat here, but I hear that if you book a table for food, you get priority over the lanes, and they can fill up really quick! So book early.I was surprised to find my favorite beer here - Blue Moon, It's a Belgium-style white beer flavored with coriander and orange.I can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of All Star Lanes - London, United Kingdom

VPEmf5Qj-v46YjnJRTKL1A.text: Came bowling here, it was pretty awesome. Cheap enough and about 15 lanes, I think.Service was pretty good too. Can't say that I'm an avid bowler though so I'm not sure what elements of bowling to grade them on but I had a good time here and I'd definitely come back. Pretty cool crowd here as well and a good number of people at all hours. Felt like a good, friendly place to be in.

1xGvNdfQRA5qYtskj2c8Yg.text: Fun place for the whole family. I've been here lots of times both with and without children. I have fun either way but it's definitely more relaxing in an adult company. The place is not very cheap but you're in for a night full of happy memories and emotions, especially if you can't bowl that well; like me. It's a real hassle to get a strike and if I do, there's a definite victory lap with lots of drinks for everyone.

xbO-eQerOIKJ6st4n7MRLg.text: Love this place. Service is excellent. Food is good. Price is reasonable and atmoaphere is fun. Highly recommened.

a5OQpGiRP1kq3-3sY8inbQ.text: All Star Lanes is a great place to go if you have a bit of disposable income and you want to do something with your friends other than going out on the lash every weekend! Their Eat, Drink & Bowl offer on Thursdays lets you have a 2 course dinner, cocktail and bowl all for only £26. The interior is great with a strong 50's theme and on the weekend they even have themed night where you can party and bowl in dress up (how cool is that?)If you're eating in the restaurant, definitely try the ribs and if you are thirsty while you bowl then definitely try the Oreo Milkshake

uoKKwQatevN90SNPOMD5Cg.text: i recently returned to all star lanes with my friend for dinner. we were in the area, but were a bit lost trying to find another place...so when we walked past here i suggested going in and grabbing some dinner. i have to admit, i was slightly dubious about the food - i don't know why but i think i figured that they more than likely specialise in bowling, drinks and fun rather than their food, but actually, it was pretty good. it IS expensive, don't get me wrong - i ordered the fish cakes, and it was one (large) fish cake in a lemon-butter sauce and three small cooked half tomatoes. You really need to order a side with their main dishes (my friend ordered the chicken schnitznel and also needed to order a side with that), and at £3+ for sides, and £11.95 (for my fish cake), this makes a fairly pricey meal for what is essentially american diner food. the food also came alarmingly quickly, which always worried me. i am sure it was all reheated, but it actually tasted alright, so it was fine. the service is what really shines in here - the guys looking after us were really lovely, and once we finished our meal, we ordered a bottle of wine and they were perfectly happy to leave us for the next couple of hours whilst we chatted over that., they didn't even ask us to settle up the bill until we were done, which i appreciated.it is huge in here, so you'd probably only need to make reservations on the weekend. having tasted their cocktails (although not this time), i can also vouch for them, and think they are definitely reasonably priced. i like the atmosphere in here, was happy to see that the grim toilets i encountered on a previous visit were no longer in such a horrible state, love the service and cocktails, but wish that the food was a little cheaper.i might even return here at some point to give bowling a go!

f0Iom9gw6mNP9x0LchsTFw.text: The old Truman Brewery has, over the years, played host to some of London's most interesting and little-known attractions.  Until recently, however, it had not housed a bowling alley.  All Star Lanes has a trio of alleys around London and they're latest addition certainly brings a different element to this famous East-End street.This isn't your standard Bowlarama bowling alley.  Befitting of Brick Lane this place goes out and out retro with an American flavour and this is reflected in the decor and music.  In addition to bowling there is also a 200 capacity restaurant offering American style cuisine and drinks - i.e. milkshakes and burgers.Just on from the restaurant you will find a set of four gleaming bowling alleys for you to test your skills and, if you've got the cash, you can request use of their private alley which features its own bar.Even though I wouldn't call myself a bowling superstar I was able to have a lot of fun here.  It's quite a relaxing down-to-earth kind of place after the furore of Brick Lane itself.  A fun night out for a large group of mates.

photos.caption: Photo of All Star Lanes - London, United Kingdom

KLTDDJZMbyGX5fQRyhKkqw.text: Came here for a private event which was very cool. Although it's quite a bit more posh (and pricey) than Bloomsbury Bowl, the atmosphere and vibe is great. It's huge inside with a number of private bowling and karaoke rooms, large screens, a couple bars and large dining areas. You really step out of Shoredtich and into another world here.But perhpas my all-star moment was realizing that their signature margarita is named Tommy's after Tommy's Mexican in the Richmond district in San Francisco! I'm sure others around me were wondering why I was freaking out and taking multiple pictures of the menu and description. So now you know. If only London could make a decent enchilada and tamale platter to go with that marg.

8RXZXEZOnYeIRFI6kIjPdw.text: All Star Lanes looks the business but I think they've put style over substance.Bowling is feels like you're on a conveyor belt and that they want you in and out so the next group of people can be swooped in. I also struggled with the bowling as I'm quite small and have small hands and the range of bowling balls is very limited. Left with a bit of an arm/wrist injury a la Justin Lee Collins. There are private lanes but I have no idea how much these cost and if it's much different from what you get in the main area.Food is typical diner fayre. The restaurant is often very busy so book. Went here last minute and there were no tables but we were offered tables in the bar area where you can also order food. We had issues with one of our group being told they were no longer allowing the bar area to order food as the kitchen was too busy. Frankly deal with it! If you serve food you are bound to get busy at a peak time, customers are often fairly understanding when it's super busy. Secondly when a complaint about the coleslaw was off, management came over and informed us the coleslaw was always made freshly everyday. I tasted the coleslaw and it was definitely off as it was really fizzy YUK! Really wanted to make the manager eat the lot to prove a point.I guess All Star Lanes is a fun alternative for a group night out but it's a bit too corporate for my liking.

yO_KoRyJJQm1HZ1K1frwng.text: Love this place , a great evening out with friends, so much to do here : bowling , pool, food and drinks  and all good .Great service as well :)

_Ecf-PoIAeU2NanYJlN_jg.text: Went here for my husband's birthday last night and had a great night. 11 of us went and had a wicked night !! We ate, the food is quite expensive, I guess not bad at all for Brick Lane but it can add up on a night out, £9 for a burger, £13 for a more substantial meal, and the bowling is £8 a go each. BUT the food is lovely, really quality burger cooked really well. We stuck to the beers last night but I've been in there before for a milkshake as well as it was excellent! Really thick and authentic american style.The bowling is really fun, with cool music, lighting and great atmosphere. I would thoroughly reccomend it.

KqVVStB490qu4e6-nCgkEQ.text: Amongst the handful of restaurants in London that attempt to deliver an American-themed dining experience, All Star Lanes [Brick Lane] is the only one that has hit the nail on the head. From the atmosphere to the food, right down to the great service, I had a grin on my face the whole time as I actually felt like I was home. The menu is pretty impressive with a mixture of food from all 50 of the United States, not just burgers, fries and milkshakes. Quesadillas, Philly Cheese Steaks and Blackened Catfish are all amongst the array of typical American cuisine and they have an impressive selection of American beers including Blue Moon and for those who really miss that flavour of the Rockies  Coors Light. Once you're finished stuffing your face with enough food to feed a small country (I recommend sharing because you will never be able to finish the baked mac n cheese but you deserve a bite!) they have a fancy bowling alley and karaoke booths. It was a nice change to bowl at a place that was not filled with smoke and smelly shoes  and we continued with the cocktails as we bowled thanks to the full bar in the bowling alley. All Star Lanes makes for a great night out of dining, drinking, and bowling for a bit of a change to the normal wine and dine. I highly recommend the blackened catfish (with Louisiana hot sauce of course) and the heavenly banana split. Pace yourself though, because this is proper American dining. I only have one gripe  that they have a Florida State Seminoles flag hanging in the entrance and the Florida Gators memorabilia was no where to be found.

S4vlSFJO9lipzGKjKjuBLA.text: So we only popped in here for a quick milkshake after a hard days work browsing the Sunday markets, but I was rather taken with the place and the milkshake was great.  The food smelled/looked good and I'd like to imagine that it would conjure up images of home in a more innocent age.  If home were America.  (Which it isn't for me).Had a quick look around the bowling lanes out back which looked cool.  This place could either be great for parties where everyone will remark at how much "fun" it is.  Or really tacky were everyone will remark at how hard you're trying to be cool.  Can't quite decide.  Still benefit of the doubt - 4 stars.  (Please mark this as cool.  Thanks).

bte-jjS7-Kq9dCg5acPRFw.text: Great burger, cooked a perfect medium rare without even having to ask. Beer, blue moon, perfect summer beer. Apparently there is bowling too!

Ns3VfB2jkGzoVRaX4hWFXw.text: Dear Philly Cheesesteak, Oh how I dream about eating you and washing you down with a thick chocolate milkshake. xx Dear Milkshake, I'll miss you now that I'm just another statistic claimed by lactose intolerance. xx All kidding aside, it's a All Star Lanes is a fun take on American themed diners ala Grease. It offers good food, nice drinks, excellent milkshakes and some bowling if you're up for it. The bar in the back is also great with a retro feel. Offers a good space for private parties too.

TcPSbVXiEvBunApfZq29LQ.text: I'm sure the bowling is great but I went purely for the food. And I wasn't disappointed.Very pleased they accomodated me and my tastecard without much notice, with smiles and kind words. I got the buttermilk fried chicken burger with chipotle and slaw. There's me thinking I was onto a winner winner, chicken dinner, until I tried my sister's nacho burger. 11/10. A mac'n'cheese and milkshake later I was more than sold. The pushy brick lane restauranters on the walk to my bus could not burst my bubble.

I3lQe1XLAevNVwFaoHXDKw.text: Great idea in concept, really poor execution. All staff members have an extremely poor understanding of the English language and reality in general to the point where orders and basic demands are not carried out or are incorrect. Venue is fantastic drinks are ok but egregiously prices, the poor staff really made my entire experience less than stellar. I don't think I will be returning for this simple reason, their sheer unwillingness to help and lack of basic English is simply unacceptable for the price you pay. The simple fact that all staff members have an extremely poor understanding of English indicate to me that managment is incapable of employing efficient human capital and this lack of respect for customers at these prices will be the sole reason for the absence of a second visit.

6xpOSpiejRkoLkLFVilZqQ.text: One of the best bowling alley/venue I've been in.Really well maintained, nice atmosphere. Food looked amazing too, although I didn't eat there. Would definitely recommend and will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of All Star Lanes - London, United Kingdom

6pzjJSaiAAQKXiknVIiWVg.text: All Star Lanes on Brick Lane is a very unique place. Somewhere where you and a group of friends can bowl, enjoy some food, and sing some karaoke. 7 of my friends and I booked online for Saturday night for all three options. Online it said "Deposit: £104". However, NO WHERE did it say "this does not include food, service charge, etc."We had a great time bowling, eating, and singing karaoke. When we were eating we thought it was odd that each person could order two courses (starter and a main or main and a dessert) with a cocktail for the £104 total. We asked two separate waiters multiple times if we would be charged extra for the food. They each said "no you already paid there's no extra charge". We thought this was way too good to be true...it was.After karaoke we went to get my credit card from the desk where they hold it and they handed us the bill and it was £350! (I am from the states and that converted to about $450). My friends and I were super confused since we were told multiple times by two waiters that there would be no extra charge. We relayed this to the ladies behind the counter and they said the waiters should have known and they told us the wrong information. We said this wasn't fair, especially since there is NOTHING online about it. One of the ladies behind the counter was nice and offered us a discount and took away the £30 service charge, the other lady wasn't so nice. We ended up only paying £25 extra per person. Although we had fun, this was definitely not worth paying £350 for. The food was only okay and the portions were tiny, the staff was unhelpful and some of them rude, although we did enjoy our night. We will not be returning though, not with those prices.

TkkvUeZ5QLMIKjgoaVEihQ.text: I went their for a dinner so the review only refers to food.So... where should I start. The food was very disappointing. And this was not only my personal opinion. Two friends I went with thought exactly the same. The burgers were over cooked, chewy and tasteless. I asked mine to be medium and I got this dry pate of minced beef instead. The sweet patato fries I order were nice...though it's not a rocket science to fry a potato. However the portion was quite small. Also the waitress had no idea if they have any ales. Actually when asked if they have any...she answered NO instead of saying that she didn't know. Surprise, surprise...I managed to even find a craft IPA after I looked in their beer menu.I definitely won't be visiting there anytime soon

photos.caption: Photo of All Star Lanes - London, United Kingdom. Skinny burger and sweet patato fries...it didn't taste as good as it looks :(

a-2anKa7p8LDO7dl1praDA.text: After all the hype I have heard about this place I suppose I had high expectations. 4 of us had prebooked a lane on Sunday for £7 a game each at 2pm for 45 mins.The location is great along Bricklane so had a lovely wander round the shops before we got there. We arrive a few minutes early and it was easy enough to pay and change our shoes over. Our lane was ready and we gave them our names which meant we were all ready to go as soon as we got to our lane. A waitress came straight over to take our drinks order. Nice and easy right? Well we started however my goodness was there a lot of kids. I guess we should have expected it but it was just kids birthday city! It would have been OK but these kids kept running in to our lane, getting in our way and sitting on the bowling balls! I suppose we got unlucky with badly behaved children and incapable parents but gosh did it ruin our fun!Lesson learnt - don't come on a Sunday.To be honest though it wasn't just this. It is a fairly small place with no real atmosphere and if you finish your game in under 45 minutes that is it.. game over. Unlike Brooklyn Bowl where music is great, they have sports on some of the TV's and you get a set time and can keep playing until it runs out.I am not sure I will be back unless with a group on a week night - no kids guarenteed.

HS7MUT4GawpJaGjm9yMnRQ.text: Was here for a team outing. The lanes are nice and barring a few technical glitches, which were resolved super fast, we had a lot of fun.This place has an exhaustive drinks menu and we were spoilt for choice. We ordered a bunch of bar snacks, which were really nice too. I particularly liked the popcorn calamari. I'd come back here for buckets of these. Everything was reasonably priced. The only reason I give four stars instead of five is because the wait staff screwed up our drinks order thrice. They were very courteous and apologetic about the whole thing. But it did piss off the people in our group a wee bit--especially those whose drinks didn't show up. All in all, a good experience and I'd definitely recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of All Star Lanes - London, United Kingdom. The lanes

V5gJGxh9vCnHhaR5nHTPtA.text: Bowling, cocktails and good food! Super nice service and thanks to them I proved the theory that bacon suits even sweet dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of All Star Lanes - London, United Kingdom. groundhog dog

PzBh421rJ-YA3Ra827CEtQ.text: As a bowling venue it is great! I would advise booking in advance as it can get pretty busy in there. Always check the website for special offers as they run them throughout the year.The facilities are all up to date and it's got a good atmosphere!   The cocktails are pretty good and they have a happy hour till 6 most nights which is worth taking advantage of.   Food wise? Ehh. For a bowling alley? It's pretty good but it is quite expensive for what it is. You can get much better food in the area for the same price and the flavour will be a lot better. Also, the food service can be quite slow.However, if you do have to eat here it's not bad! The mac and cheese is pretty decent and the burgers are alright too!   They also have pool and karaoke at this venue so it's a good place for a one stop shop night out.

BPcrLMrBUgbbBoU4PhdsnQ.text: Want to take a time machine back to 1950's America? This is your place!The decor is fantastic and super retro, it's super clean and there's all sorts of fun to get into. The bowling alley is a bit small (I think there's 6 lanes? I forget. Maybe 8?) but each lane can hold quite a few players so it's still good for big groups I imagine. There's also pool tables and some other games I think, though we were there to bowl. We did have to wait a bit for our reserved lane though, I recommend calling ahead. The drink menu is fun and impressive and very sugary, but there's a full bar for whatever you might want. It was a bit dead in there on a weekend but we were there kind of early. Either way, it was fun and we had a great time, and staff was very nice!

U9Rd039UQU02g3L6OdWBgw.text: Been wanting to come here for a very long time now, finally stubble upon All star lanes on my day off. Love bowling but didn't get a chance too but will do next time. Food was the my priority and what a place to eat, atmosphere was great  the staff were out standing and dress the part, food was deliciously beautiful,  and so far the best root beer drink. Would definitely come again.

photos.caption: Photo of All Star Lanes - London, United Kingdom. Heavenly
Photo of All Star Lanes - London, United Kingdom
Photo of All Star Lanes - London, United Kingdom

V55OL6uczNY29hIkGrNLvQ.text: All Star Lanes is the younger brother that copies what the older brother does so well, and then polishes it up a little. The little brother will never be quite as edgy or cool, but he'll end up more successful no doubt. The older brother I speak of is Bloomsbury Lanes, which lead London down the path to retro bowling and drinking.What you will get with All Star Lanes is a big, pristine space flooded with staff and well maintained bowling alleys. They'll pinch your pockets for the food and drink you go for, it really isn't cheap, but you know what you're getting every time you go.That being said, not sure I'm a fan of the apparent requirement to eat here after/before you bowl or take the financial penalty for not doing so. Doesn't really seem in keeping with the fun-time vibes they try to sell!Limited range of beer at the bar, it's pricey Blue Moon or Coors on tap - although they do have a decent range of bottled beers to get stuck into (see reference to getting your pockets pinched above though).Overall, fun to be had, and they're reliable and professional in what they do. Just don't expect a cheap night.

jWlM2UlkK0FWObHCRmQ0MQ.text: Bowling in London?  It's not Westminster Abbey or the Tower of London, but All Star Lanes is worth a visit if you have a sudden urge to bowl in Shoreditch.  They'll set you up with some slick velcro bowling shoes, and then you can crowd around a small handful of lanes and chuck your balls (ahem) at the pins.Want some cocktails?  The selection is dizzying, but whatever you do, stay far and clear from the pina colada.  It's tastes neither of pina nor colada, but there are plenty of other great choices.Want dinner, too?  I was skeptical about eating in a bowling alley with a somewhat cheezy party atmosphere, but the menu features something for everyone (duck confit or ribs?  tagliatelle or buttermilk fried chicken?).  Don't ask me why I ordered the tagliatelle, but I did.  And you know what?  It wasn't just good, it was great.Crazy place.

86S0pE6w-TihBpDf-m96JQ.text: I don't actually believe that anyone bowls here. I've seen bowling alleys, but I've never seen them in use. I think the staff just stand behind the counter and tell people they're fully booked, and can't fit anyone else in.Okay, I jest. But if you do want to bowl here, you're going to have to book well in advance.I came here with a few friends for a relaxing evening in the restaurant/diner area. If you are meeting people here, for some reason it can be really hard to identify them. I thought it was just me, but every member of our party circled the entire venue a few times before having to wander back outside (there's barely any phone signal in there) to try and contact us.One settled, we were lucky enough to have a friendly and funny waitress who kept the drinks flowing for us. Try the 'Zombie' cocktail - it's pretty lethal, and comes blazing. Like, actually on fire.I opted for the fried chicken basket and sweet potato fries, which was pretty good. The chicken was very tender and the spice was done right. Though not a place to go for an amazing culinary experience, it is good for a fun night out with friends.

dgHx9BwBUyQt9oeNBqPpJw.text: Disco-bowling is sooooooo 2012! I swear it is so much fun, you should try....When I think of bowling, I usually think of middle-aged men in some sort of grubby bowling alley... Not the case at All Star Lanes!It's clean, it looks funky, excellent service and good food.The bowling is absolute fun; it starts with the shoes. Seriously, I reckon you can make these into fashion item one day. Right, so the shoes are on, it's time to get into serious bowling... you get a table & lane with your friends and off you go. I was totally rubbish, seriously, I was. But it was good fun and the cocktails made it all better. They have a good range of different cocktails, I tried the Dark 'n' Stormy... and stormy it was. Quickly switched to beer, I reckon that after 3 of these Dark 'n' Stormies, I'll be  throwing the bowling balls into the wrong direction.Afterwards, we went for dinner. I tried the baby ribs and the caesar salad. The ribs were very very very tender. The Caesar salad was very good, the kind of classic caesar that you expect, and then yesss, you also get served.Apparently, they also do karaoke... will definitely try that as well. I looooove this kind of entertaining evenings out with friends!

4OYoED8LeridZFzcoVNviQ.text: the mac 'n' cheese was bland bland bland. Should've ordered it with bacon! But I don't know why I didnt, or why they didn't offer?we also had the quesedillas and also the salt and pepper squid for starters. The squid was great, and it was packed in a makeshift takeaway cardboard box, like you do from a chinese takeaway. It was really cute. The quesedillas were solid. I'm just sad my main let the whole thing down.The cocktails are where it's at though. The Julep Jar is lovely. It wasn't too sweet but also quite refreshing! Didn't try the bowling but we did go underdog afterwards for more cocktails! Woop

ZqmVFDbGLXy3u7_aB3gn3w.text: I usually hate bowling. Especially bowling that tries to be more than it is. Light up lanes and a night club atmosphere does not make bowling anymore interesting. Please. Stop.BUT. I had an excellent Sunday afternoon at All Star Lanes. Yes it's a bowling alley with mood lighting and cool decor, but it neither takes itself too seriously or goes over the top with kitschy, experiential add-ons. The food is great, the atmosphere is relaxed and it is very reasonably priced - we paid £6.95 each for a game and shoes. The front section is a large dining room and I would definitely go back and make a full evening of All Star Lanes.

pratzRlP44C1dGTGMT7FMw.text: On approach, the hustle and bustle disguise this 10 pin 10 star venue. You walk in the doors and are taken back by the ambient sounds of the American style diner. Classic 50's tracks compliment the modern take on a period design. The party I was wit had bowling booked, and the 10 minutes allocated to organise the groups classic Puma bowling footwear was substantial. What I personally found amazing was that by the time we arrived at our assigned lane(s) our names were already on the screens! After the Bowling which went without a hitch, we took our seats in a both awaiting to be seated at our table for food. Within the time the waitress approximated, we were sat down on a suitable table which had fresh, cool water awaiting to cleanse our mouths for the fantastic food that shortly followed. The grub was what you would expect from an American diner styled resturaunt, Burgers Ribs, Fries, a range of salads and then a Crab. All looked and tasted fantastic, there were no complaints among-st our group. Even paying was made simple, 10 people, 10 debit cards, two waitresses taking payments, it made everything nice and simple. Bowling £8(ish) Meal £15Would I go again? already have!!!

tw4d7rA_EdavHT73YqodNA.text: Who would've thought a humble pair of swinging doors would lead into such a cavernous bowling alley.All Star Lanes is a nod to glamor bowling.  For you big city Americans out there, think of it as Lucky Strikes meeting TGIF with Americana amped way up. Plenty of suits and skirts stop in on weeknights just to roll a few.A large dining area and lounge/bar tucked in the back makes this an ideal venue for office parties or get-togethers. Sadly the food menu isn't very inspiring in the way of variety or pricing: on last check a philly cheese steak went for 12 quids. Just 30 feet down Brick Lane one could easily find alternative burger and hot plate options.Blue Moon is allegedly on tap but only bottles were served the night of my visit. Can't complain. Let's hope they sign Fat Tire soon.

BuTFQET1Xlm7_FrSZm7bAw.text: I came here for my friends 30th and was very impressed! The decor is finnnnneeeee!!We started off with bowling, their are six lanes which are short and sweet, which was good because it made me come second and it was the first time I did not use barriers.The price of a game is £6.75 which is off-peak price, after 6pm its £8:75.The bowling alley was slick and immaculate, and the lighting gave the bowling a beautiful ambiance. The birthday girl did book another session of bowling, but All Stars must of double booked or something it was all good because it worked in our favor.All stars have two karaoke, which can hold up to 7-14 people. Our rate was £60 but split between ten people it was cheaper. They had a good song selection with all your karaoke favorites. The room gets hot as you can imagine ten people singing their hearts out and dancing like maniacs. They could of done with wayyyy y better air-con. I was pleasantly surprised, me being tall and all, i was doing a dance while standing on the seats and i did not touch the ceiling with my head. We were overrun the hour, but the staff allowed us more time with no extra cost, sweeeeeet!!The customer service was Awesome!! The staff were friendly and I liked their retro uniforms.I cant comment on the drinks and food, because I did not try anything, but the cocktails looked fly in the jam jars.If you reserve a bowling alley and you and your guest do not turn up on time you get charged, luckily we all came on time. Cant wait to come here again, I'm sure when I do it will get an extra star. :)
